the rest of the mitt © 2014 by b s knees knits remainder of mitt k 1 round second round k1 k2tog k around the rest of the mitt knit until mitt is 3/4 shorter than desired length k2 p2 for 6 row bind off using the p2tog bind-off or using some other stretchy bind-off thumb put thumb sts on needle s removing waste yarn knit around the thumb picking up 1 sts where you cast on the additional st using the backwards-loop method knit 5 row bind off using the p2tog bind-off or some other bind-off of your choice weave in ends knit second mitt as first definitions k = knit p = purl pm = place marker sl m = slip marker m1 on thumb gusset- make either a m1r or m1l m1r = pick up the top strand of the ladder between your right and left needle so that the left leg of the st is coming over the front of the needle knit through the front loop m1l = pick up the top strand of the ladder between your right and left needle so that the right leg of the needle is coming over the front of the left needle knit through the back loop p2tog bind-off p2tog move just-worked st back to left-hand needle repeat until all sts have been worked © 2014 by b s knees knits helpful hints a tutorial for the german
